text: how do you get a shiny granite rock
weighing almost 20 kilograms to stop on
a target some 30 metres away with great
difficulty that's what makes curling
such a hard sport to master shot
the scoring system is similar to the one
that's used in long balls for teams
getting points for getting their stones
closest to the target if the scores are
level after ten ends play continues and
curlies wear special shoes one of them
has a grip they can used to push off the
other one no grip so they can glide
the ice is pebbled so Jade and I are
brushing furiously to try and melt those
pebbles and influence where the stone
ends up come on Jade we can do it
optin afternoon of smoothing down the
ice pebbles I still haven't managed to
hit the target it appears the road to
mastering curling is a bumpy one
